channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: A previously reported problem at this locality has now got considerably worse, see photo. Big ivy bush has now come across almost entire width of Glos CC public rights of way, and also has an active wasps nest within it. Young mothers and children will no longer be able to access this route to get to the nearby school, and also risk being stung., 13th August
item.description:
In lane running alongside north of Lakeside School field, behind Hazebrouck Close.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Hazebrouck Close, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The years old trench made up of several potholes which, not property mended, have joined up., 12th August
item.description:
On the left hand carriageway of Ermin Street, going from Green Street towards Golf Club Way. Highly visible, just in the right place to catch cyclists as well as drivers. Has been there for many years and reported several times; there have been Council claims that it has been fixed but hard to see why as it obviously has not.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 53, Ermin Street, Brockworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
